member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.IPhysicsObject.CenterOfMass
member.summary: Gers or sets the relative position of the default center of mass, which is at (0, 0, 0).
member.remarks: This value can be used to set the relative offset of the center of mass of a rigid body. When a rigid body is created the center of mass is set the the point (0, 0, 0), and normally this is the best setting for a rigid body. However the are situations in which and object does not have symmetry or simple some kind of special effect is desired, and this origin need to be changed.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.GPS.GPS
member.summary:
This is a GPS class for reading data from a serial port and parsing the data into useful coordinates.
The GPS is assumed to be on a serial port. Code has been tested on USB and Bluetooth based GPS devices. To use, create a new instance of the GPS and add a GPSListener delegate or poll the object.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.GPS.GPS.ParseGPGGA(System.String)
member.summary: Parses $GPGGA - Global Positioning System Fix Data
member.remarks: Referenced from http://home.mira.net/~gnb/gps/nmea.html#gpgga

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.GPS.GPS.ParseGPRMC(System.String)
member.summary: Parses $GPRMC - Recommended Minimum Specific GPS/TRANSIT Data
member.remarks:
Referenced from http://home.mira.net/~gnb/gps/nmea.html#gprmc
$GPRMC,hhmmss.ss,A,llll.ll,a,yyyyy.yy,a,x.x,x.x,ddmmyy,x.x,a,m*hh Field # 1 = UTC time of fix 2 = Data status (A=Valid position, V=navigation receiver warning) 3 = Latitude of fix 4 = N or S of longitude 5 = Longitude of fix 6 = E or W of longitude 7 = Speed over ground in knots 8 = Track made good in degrees True 9 = UTC date of fix 10 = Magnetic variation degrees (Easterly var. subtracts from true course) 11 = E or W of magnetic variation 12 = Mode indicator, (A=Autonomous, D=Differential, E=Estimated, N=Data not valid) 13 = Checksum
member.param: String to parse

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.GPS.GPS.NMEADegreesToDecimal(System.String)
member.summary: Converts NMEA degrees decimal-minutes to decimal-degrees.
member.param: NMEA string

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.Generic.KeyboardInput
member.summary: A helper class for handling the keyboard input. This class wraps the functionalities provided by XNA's KeyboardState class. Keyboard events are handled based on interrupt method (callback functions), rather than the polling method (XNA's KeyboardState), so that the developer doesn't need to poll the status of the keyboard state every frame by herself/himself.
member.remarks: KeyboardInput is a singleton class, so you should access this class through Instance property.

member.summary: Keyboard state, set every frame in the Update method.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.BranchNode.Children
member.summary: Gets a list of this node's children.
member.remarks: You should never add or remove nodes directly from this list since the changes won't be reflected in the scene. You should instead use the Add or Remove methods provided in this class.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.BranchNode.Prune
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to prune the node's children
member.remarks: If set to true, children nodes will simply not be traversed in the scene graph, but won't actually be removed from the scene graph. The default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether this node is added to rendering routine

member.summary: Gets or sets whether this node should be rendered

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.GeometryNode.IsOccluder
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this node is used as an occluder that occludes any object that is rendered behind this object

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.GeometryNode.BoundingVolume
member.summary: Gets a sphere that encloses the contents of all the nodes below the current one.
member.remarks: This node itself is not included in this bounding sphere

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.GeometryNode.ShowBoundingVolume
member.summary: Gets or sets if the bounding volume (sphere) should be displayed. (Currently not implemented)

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.GeometryNode.IgnoreDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to ignore the depth buffer for drawing this geometry. Default value is false.
member.remarks: Anything other than the drawing (e.g., physics simulation) will still take the depth into consideration even if this is set to true.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.GeometryNode.AlwaysRender
member.summary: Indicates whether to render this geometry regardless of whether the bounding sphere of the associated model is within the view frustum of the main camera. The default value is false.
member.remarks: This property is ignored if Scene.EnableFrustumCulling is set to false.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LODNode.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{GoblinXNA.Graphics.IModel})
member.summary: Creates a LOD (Level Of Detail) node that holds a list of models with different level of details.
member.param: The name of this node (has to be unique for correct networking behavior)
A list of models with different level of details

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LODNode.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{GoblinXNA.Graphics.IModel})
member.summary: Creates a LOD (Level Of Detail) node that holds a list of models with different level of details.
member.param: A list of models with different level of details

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LODNode.Update(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Updates the level of details using the given camera (viewer) location.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LODNode.Models
member.summary: Gets or sets a set of models with different level of details to use.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LODNode.LevelOfDetail
member.summary: Gets or sets current level of detail. Default value is 0. The value has to be between 0 and number of models - 1 (Models.Count - 1).
member.remarks: If AutoComputerLevelOfDetail is set to true, then setting this value would NOT take effect.
member.exception: If level of detail is out of range

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LODNode.AutoComputeLevelOfDetail
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to automatically compute the appropriate level of details to use based on the distances set in AutoComputeDistances.
member.remarks: You have to also set AutoComputeDistances if you set this value to true.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LODNode.AutoComputeDistances
member.summary: Gets or sets the distances to use to switch among different level of details automatically when AutoComputeLevelOfDetail is set to true. The number of distances should be (Models.Count - 1).
member.exception: If number of distances is incorrect

member.summary: Gets the port number used to transfer messages.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Network.IClient.MyIPAddress
member.summary: Gets the address of this client in 4 bytes.
member.remarks: It returns 4 bytes instead of String in order to optimize network transfer. (e.g., 192.168.0.1 will be byte[0] = (byte)192, byte[1] = (byte)168, byte[2] = (byte)0, byte[3] = (byte)1)

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Network.IClient.EnableEncryption
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable encryption.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Network.IClient.WaitForServer
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to wait for the server to start up in case the server is not running when client tried to connect. To set the timeout for connection trial, set the ConnectionTrialTimeOut property. Default value is false.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Network.IClient.ConnectionTrialTimeOut
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout in milliseconds for connection trial when the server was not up when client was started. This property is only effective if WaitForServer is set to true. Default value is -1 which means the client waits for infinite time.

The port number to establish the connection
The name of the server machine

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DTextField
member.summary:
A text field displays a text string based on the user's keyboard input. This component needs to be focused in order to receive the keyboard input.
In order to display the text and the caret, G2DTextField.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the text and caret will not show up.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DLabel
member.summary:
A display area for a text string. A label does not react to input events such as keyboard or mouse events. You can specify the location of the label with respect to the display area by setting the horizontal and vertical alignment.
In order to display the text, G2DLabel.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the text will not show up.

member.summary: Creates a display area for a short text string with an empty text.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ExplosionParticleEffect
member.summary: A particle system that simulates an explosion effect.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect
member.summary: Particle effects are custom vertex-based effects like exhaust steams, fire and smoke. The implementation is based on the Particle 3D tutorial from the XNA Creators Club website (http://creators.xna.com).

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.particles
member.summary: An array of particles, treated as a circular queue.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.vertexBuffer
member.summary: A vertex buffer holding our particles. This contains the same data as the particles array, but copied across to where the GPU can access it.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.indexBuffer
member.summary: Index buffer turns sets of four vertices into particle quads (pairs of triangles).

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.currentTime
member.summary: Store the current time, in seconds.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.drawCounter
member.summary: Count how many times Draw has been called. This is used to know when it is safe to retire old particles back into the free list.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.random
member.summary: Shared random number generator.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default particle effect with 100 maximum particles.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a default particle effect.
member.param: Maximum number of particles that can be displayed at one time.

member.summary: Loads graphics for the particle system.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.Update(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Updates the particle system.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.RetireActiveParticles
member.summary: Helper for checking when active particles have reached the end of their life. It moves old particles from the active area of the queue to the retired section.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.FreeRetiredParticles
member.summary: Helper for checking when retired particles have been kept around long enough that we can be sure the GPU is no longer using them. It moves old particles from the retired area of the queue to the free section.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.Render(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary: Renders this particle effect using the given shader.
member.param: The transformation to apply to this particle system

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.AddNewParticlesToVertexBuffer
member.summary: Helper for uploading new particles from our managed array to the GPU vertex buffer.

member.summary: Adds a new particle to the system.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.Reset
member.summary: Resets the particle effect if it supports reset.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.Shader
member.summary: Gets or sets a shader to render this particle effect

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.ShaderTechnique
member.summary: Gets or sets the shader technique to use .

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this particle effect should be rendered. The default is true.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.TextureName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the texture used by this particle system.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MaxParticles
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of particles that can be displayed at one time.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets how long these particles will last.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.DurationRandomness
member.summary:
Gets or sets the plus/minus value randomly added to Duration.
If greater than zero, some particles will last a shorter time than others.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.EmitterVelocitySensitivity
member.summary: Controls how much particles are influenced by the velocity of the object that created them. You can see this in action with the explosion effect, where the flames continue to move in the same direction as the source projectile. The projectile trail particles, on the other hand, set this value very low so they are less affected by the velocity of the projectile.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MinHorizontalVelocity
member.summary: Mininum of the range of values controlling how much X and Z axis velocity to give each particle. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between this value and MaxHorizontalVelocity.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MaxHorizontalVelocity
member.summary: Maximum of the range of values controlling how much X and Z axis velocity to give each particle. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between MinHorizontalVelocity and this value.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MinVerticalVelocity
member.summary: Minimum of the range of values controlling how much Y axis velocity to give each particle. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between this value and MaxVerticalVelocity.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MaxVerticalVelocity
member.summary: Maximum of the range of values controlling how much Y axis velocity to give each particle. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between MinVerticalVelocity and this value.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.Gravity
member.summary: Direction and strength of the gravity effect. Note that this can point in any direction, not just down! The fire effect points it upward to make the flames rise, and the smoke plume points it sideways to simulate wind.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.EndVelocity
member.summary: Controls how the particle velocity will change over their lifetime. If set to 1, particles will keep going at the same speed as when they were created. If set to 0, particles will come to a complete stop right before they die. Values greater than 1 make the particles speed up over time. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MinColor
member.summary: Minimum of range of values controlling the particle color and alpha. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between this color and MaxColor. The default value is Color.Black.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MaxColor
member.summary: Maximum of range of values controlling the particle color and alpha. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between MinColor and this value.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MinRotateSpeed
member.summary: Minimum of range of values controlling how fast the particles rotate. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between these limits. If both these values are set to 0, the particle system will automatically switch to an alternative shader technique that does not support rotation, and thus requires significantly less GPU power. This means if you don't need the rotation effect, you may get a performance boost from leaving these values at 0.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MaxRotateSpeed
member.summary: Maximum of range of values controlling how fast the particles rotate. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between these limits. If both these values are set to 0, the particle system will automatically switch to an alternative shader technique that does not support rotation, and thus requires significantly less GPU power. This means if you don't need the rotation effect, you may get a performance boost from leaving these values at 0.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MinStartSize
member.summary: Minimum of range of values controlling how big the particles are when first created. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between MinStartSize and MaxStartSize.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MaxStartSize
member.summary: Maximum of range of values controlling how big the particles are when first created. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between MinStartSize and MaxStartSize.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MinEndSize
member.summary: Minimum of range of values controlling how big particles become at the end of their life. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between MinEndSize and MaxEndSize.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.MaxEndSize
member.summary: Maximum of range of values controlling how big particles become at the end of their life. Values for individual particles are randomly chosen from somewhere between MinEndSize and MaxEndSize.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.BlendState
member.summary: Alpha blending settings.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.Up
member.summary: A direction in which vertical velocity is applied. Default is Vector3.UnitY.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.Right
member.summary: A direction in which horizontal velocity is applied. Default is Vector3.UnitX.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.Forward
member.summary: A direction in which horizontal velocity is applied. Default is Vector3.UnitZ.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.CurrentTime
member.summary: Gets the time elapsed since the particle simulation started.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ParticleEffect.DrawOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the order of drawing each particle effect. Smaller value is drawn earlier.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects.ExplosionParticleEffect.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an explosion particle system.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera
member.summary: This class represents a stereo camera view. Stereo only works if proper shutter glass and graphics card are used.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera
member.summary: Camera represents a view frustum (camera) in the 3D space. It describes how the viewed 3D space is transformed to a 2D surface (render window).

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a camera with vertical field of view of 45 degrees, 1.0f near clipping plane and 1000f far clipping plane.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.#ctor(GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera)
member.summary: Copy constructor.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.Translation
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of this camera's view point. The default value is (0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of this camera's view point. The initial forward vector is (0, 0, -1) (into the display), and the up vector is (0, 1, 0).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.View
member.summary: Gets or sets the view transform.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.CameraTransformation
member.summary: Gets the transformation created by composing Rotation and Translation.
member.remarks: = Matrix.CreateFromQuaternion(rotation) * Matrix.CreateTranslation(translation)

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.Projection
member.summary: Gets or sets the projection matrix of this camera. If this matrix is not set, then the project matrix is calculated by using the FieldOfViewY, AspectRatio, ZNearPlane, and ZFarPlane. If this matrix is set to a matrix, then that matrix will be returned when accessing this value.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.FieldOfViewY
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical field of view in radians. The default value is MathHelper.ToRadians(45)

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.AspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the aspect ratio. Default value is set to Viewport.Width / Viewport.Height

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.ZNearPlane
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance of the near clipping plane from the view position. The default value is 1.0f.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.ZFarPlane
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance of the far clipping plane from the view position. The default value is 1000.0f;

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a stereo camera.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera.#ctor(GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera)
member.summary: A copy constructor.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera.InterpupillaryDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the two eyes, measured at the pupils.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera.InterpupillaryShift
member.summary: Gets or sets the shift of the interpupillary distance from the center of the two eyes. Positive value will shift toward the right eye, and negative value will shift toward the left eye. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: This property is used when center of the stereo display is not in the middle of the two eyes.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera.FocalLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the focal length from the camera/eye.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera.LeftView
member.summary: Gets or sets the view matrix of the left eye.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera.RightView
member.summary: Gets or sets the view matrix of the right eye.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera.LeftProjection
member.summary: Gets or sets the projection matrix of the left eye.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.StereoCamera.RightProjection
member.summary: Gets or sets the projection matrix of the right eye.

member.summary: Creates a capsule (a cylinder with hemisphere caps) oriented along the Y axis. If the height is less than radius * 2, then the height is clamped to radius * 2.
member.param: The radius of the hemisphere caps
The height of the capsule (including the hemisphere caps). If less than radius * 2, them clamped to radius * 2
The number of subdivisions around the Y axis (similar to lines of longitude). This has to be greater than 4 and less than 101.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Shaders.Shader
member.summary: A basic implementation of the IShader interface that doesn't use XNA's BasicEffect class.
member.remarks:
It's recommended that a new shader class extends this base shader class.
None of the SetParameter(..) functions are implemented, so your extended shader class should implement the features your shader class supports.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Shaders.IShader
member.summary: An interface for a shader class.
member.remarks: A shader class should either extend an existing IShader implementation or implement this class. However, function body can be empty for any of the SetParameter(...) methods if your shader implementation doesn't support the specific property.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode
member.summary:
A scene graph node that defines an optically tracked fiducial marker.
Any nodes added below a MarkerNode with WorldTranformation properties will be affected by the transformation returned by the marker tracker including GeometryNode, ParticleNode, SoundNode, CameraNode, and LightNode.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.#ctor(System.String,GoblinXNA.Device.Vision.Marker.IMarkerTracker,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a node that is tracked by fiducial marker (can be either an array or a single marker) and updated automatically.
member.param: Name of this marker node
A marker tracker used to track this fiducial marker
A list of configs that specify the fiducial marker (can be either an array or a single marker) to look for

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.#ctor(GoblinXNA.Device.Vision.Marker.IMarkerTracker,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a node that is tracked by fiducial marker (can be either an array or a single marker) and updated automatically.
member.param: A marker tracker used to track this fiducial marker
A list of configs that specify the fiducial marker (can be either an array or a single marker) to look for

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.CloneNode
member.summary: Marker node does not allow cloning a node.
member.exception: If this method is called

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.Update(System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the current matrix of this marker node
member.param: Elapsed time from last update in milliseconds

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.MarkerID
member.summary: Gets the marker ID returned by the marker tracker library.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.Smoother
member.summary: Gets or sets the smoother used to filter the matrix returned by the optical marker tracker.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.Predictor
member.summary: Gets or sets the prediction filter to apply to the transformation returned by the optical marker tracker.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.MaxDropouts
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of dropouts. If it fails to detect the marker within 'MaxDropouts' frames, the WorldTransform becomes an empty matrix. Set this value to -1 number if you want to keep the last detected transformation indefinitely when the marker is not found.
member.remarks: Dropout count is used to make marker tracking more stable. For example, if MaxDropouts is set to 5, then even if the marker is not detected for 5 frames, it will use the previously detected transformation.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.MarkerFound
member.summary: Gets whether the marker is detected.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.InverseCameraView
member.summary: Gets or sets the inverse transform of the current camera's view matrix. Set this property if your camera's view matrix is other than an Identity matrix. Setting this properly will ensure that your geometry attached to this marker node will appear on top of the marker.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.WorldTransformation
member.summary: Gets the transformation of the detected marker.
member.remarks: If no marker is detected after MaxDropouts, then transformation matrix with all zero values is returned.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.Optimize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to optimize the scene graph by not traversing the nodes added below this node if marker is not found.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ShadowAttribute
member.summary: An enum that indicates how the object will be used in a shadow mapping shader.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ShadowAttribute.None
member.summary: Indicates that this model does not cast or receive shadow when shadow mapping is in use.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ShadowAttribute.ReceiveOnly
member.summary: Indicates that this model receives shadows cast by other objects that can cast shadows, but does not cast shadows on other objects.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ShadowAttribute.ReceiveCast
member.summary: Indicates that this model receives shadows cast by other objects that can cast shadows, and also cast shadows on other objects that can receive shadows. This model receives self-casted shadows.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.State
member.summary: The main class of the Goblin XNA framework.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.State.InitGoblin(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.IGraphicsDeviceService,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager,System.String)
member.summary: This is the very first method that needs to be called before using any of the Goblin XNA framework.
member.param: GraphicsDeviceManager object from the main Game class
ContentManager object from the main Game class

The full path of the setting file in XML format. Setting file is used, for example, to specify where the model files are stored if not directly under "Content" directory. You can also add your own setting variable with certain value, and retrieve the value using GetSettingVariable method.
Can be an empty string, in which case, a template setting file (template_setting.xml) that contains all of the setting variables used in Goblin XNA will be generated. If you don't specify the setting file, then all of the resource files (e.g., models, textures, spritefonts, etc) should be directly stored under the "Content" directory, so Goblin XNA can figure out where to load those resources.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.State.GetSettingVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the setting variables loaded at the initialization time.
member.param: The name of the setting variable

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.State.LoadSettings(System.String)
member.summary: Loads all of the added setting variables.
member.param: the filename where the setting variables are stored

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.State.WriteSettingTemplate
member.summary: Writes out a template setting file that contains all of the setting variables used in Goblin XNA.

member.summary: Gets or sets the threading options by oring the ThreadOptions enum. This property is used to control what operations to be threaded. If your CPU is single-core, then there is no point to thread any operations.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether this machine acts as a server when networking is enabled

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.State.NumberOfClientsToWait
member.summary: Number of clients to wait for connections before starting physics simulation. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.State.LogPrintLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the log levels that will be printed out. Default value is LogLevel.Error.
member.example: LogLevel.Log means prints out all log levels including Warning and Error messages. LogLevel.Warning means prints out only Warning and Error messages. LogLevel.Error means prints out only Error messages.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.State.ShowFPS

member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the FPS or triangle count text. The default color is Color.White.

member.summary: Adds a collision callback function. You need to set the CollisionPair.PhysicsObject1 and CollisionPair.PhysicsObject2, but you shouldn't set other properties of CollisionPair. Other properties of CollisionPair are set automatically when it's returned from the CollisionCallback delegate/callback function.
member.remarks: You can't add more than one collision callback function for the same collision pair.
member.param: A pair of IPhysicsObject to detect collisions
The callback function to be called when the pair collides

member.summary:
A G2D component that displays an integer value within a bounded interval. This component is typically used to express the progress of some task by displaying the percentage completed and optionally, a textual display of the percentage.
In order to display the percentage completed text, G2DProgressBar.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the text will not show up.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Geometry.Torus
member.summary: A torus geometry primitive constructed with CustomMesh

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Geometry.Torus.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a torus of the given inner and outer radius around the Y axis centered around the origin. The torus is subdivided around the Y axis into slices and around the torus tubes into stacks.
member.param: The inner radius of the torus. This has to be greater than or equal to 0 and less than outer radius.
The outer radius of the torus. This has to be greater than 0 and larger than the inner radius
Specifies the number of subdivisions around the Y axis. This has to be greater than 4 and greater than 101.
Specifies the number of subdivisions around the torus tube. This has to be greater than 4 and greater than 101.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Geometry.Cylinder
member.summary: A cylinder geometry primitive constructed with CustomMesh

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Geometry.Cylinder.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a cylinder (actually a truncated cone) oriented along the Y axis. The base of the cylinder is placed at Y = -height/2, and the top at height/2 = height. A cylinder is subdivided around the Y axis into slices.
member.param: Specifies the radius of the cylinder at y = -height/2.
Specifies the radius of the cylinder at y = height/2.
Specifies the height of the cylinder.
Specifies the number of subdivisions around the Y axis. Should be greater than or equal to 3.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI3D.UI3DRenderer
member.summary: A helper class for performing 3D drawing, such as drawing 3D lines and 3D texts.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.UI3D.UI3DRenderer.Write3DText(System.String,Nuclex.Fonts.VectorFont,GoblinXNA.UI.UI3D.UI3DRenderer.Text3DStyle,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary: Draws a 3D text with the given font, style, color, and transformation.
member.remarks: This 3D text won't be actually drawn until Flush() method is called. If this method is called before base.Draw(...) in your main Game class's Draw(...) function, then it's automatically flushed when base.Draw(...) is called. If this method is called after base.Draw(...) function, then you need to call Flush() function after calling one or more of this function. Otherwise, the 3D texts drawing will be deferred until the next base.Draw(...) or Flush() call.
member.param: Text string to be displayed in 3D.
Font to use for the 3D text.
3D text style (Outline, Fill, or Extrude).
Color of the 3D text.
Transformation of the left-bottom corner of the 3D text.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.UI3D.UI3DRenderer.Write3DText(System.String,Nuclex.Fonts.VectorFont,GoblinXNA.UI.UI3D.UI3DRenderer.Text3DStyle,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,GoblinXNA.GoblinEnums.HorizontalAlignment,GoblinXNA.GoblinEnums.VerticalAlignment)
member.summary: Draws a 3D text with the given font, style, color, transformation, horizontal align, and vertical align.
member.remarks: This 3D text won't be actually drawn until Flush() method is called. If this method is called before base.Draw(...) in your main Game class's Draw(...) function, then it's automatically flushed when base.Draw(...) is called. If this method is called after base.Draw(...) function, then you need to call Flush() function after calling one or more of this function. Otherwise, the 3D texts drawing will be deferred until the next base.Draw(...) or Flush() call.
member.param: Text string to be displayed in 3D.
Font to use for the 3D text.
3D text style (Outline, Fill, or Extrude).
Color of the 3D text.
Transformation of the 3D text.
The horizontal (x-axis) shifting

member.summary: A sphere geometry primitive with texture coordinates constructed with CustomMesh

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Geometry.TexturedSphere.#ctor(System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a sphere of the given radius centered around the origin. The sphere is subdivided around the Y axis into slices and along the Y axis into stacks (similar to lines of longitude and latitude). The texture coordinates are assigned using normal spherical mapping.
member.param: Specifies the radius of the sphere.
Specifies the number of subdivisions around the Y axis (similar to lines of longitude). This has to be greater than 4 and less than 101.
Specifies the number of subdivisions along the Y axis (similar to lines of latitude). This has to be greater than 4 and less than 101.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Geometry.PartialDisk
member.summary: A partial disk geometry primitive constructed with CustomMesh

member.summary: A disk geometry primitive constructed with CustomMesh

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Geometry.Disk.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a disk or annulus on the y = 0 plane. The disk has a radius of outer, and contains a concentric circular hole with a radius of inner. If inner is 0, then no hole is generated. The disk is subdivided around the Y axis into radial slices (like pizza slices)
member.param: Specifies the inner radius of the disk (may be 0).
Specifies the outer radius of the disk. Must be larger than the 'inner' radius
Specifies the number of subdivisions around the Y axis. Must be larger than 2.
Specifies whether to render both front and back side

members.member:
Creates a partial disk on the Y = 0 plane. A partial disk is similar to a full disk, except that only the subset of the disk from start through start + sweep is included (where 0 degrees is along the +Y axis, 90 degrees along the +X axis)
Specifies the inner radius of the partial disk (can be 0). Specifies the outer radius of the partial disk. Must be greater than the 'inner' radius. Specifies the number of subdivisions around the Z axis. Must be greater than 2. Specifies the starting angle, in radians, of the disk portion. Specifies the sweep angle, in radians, of the disk portion. /// Specifies whether to render both front and back side

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Device.Vision.Marker.ALVARMarkerTracker.DetectorID
member.summary:
Gets or sets the current marker detector ID. The current detector ID specifies which marker detector to use when more than one detector is added in the case you need more than one instance of marker detector. For instance, if you plan to track markers from different video capture devices at the same time (e.g., stereo mode with two physical cameras), then you will need two marker detector instances for proper tracking (ALVAR makes assumptions based on history information for performing tracking on images with sharp angle or far away, so if you pass images from different physical location sequentially, the tracking will get very messy).
Make sure to add a new marker detector before setting this property, and use ALVARDllBridge.alvar_add_marker_detector(...) function to add a new marker detector. The detector ID is the return value of this function if no error occurs.
member.remarks: Generally, you only need one instance of marker detector, so unless you add and need more than one instances of marker detector, it's best not to change this property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Device.Vision.Marker.ALVARMarkerTracker.CameraID
member.summary: Gets or sets the current camera ID used by the marker detector. A camera in ALVAR contains lens intrinsic parameters and distortion information, so if you use different physical capture devices for tracking, then you should add additional camera. Make sure to add a new camera before setting this property, and use ALVARDllBridge.alvar_add_camera(...) function to add a new camera.
member.remarks: Generally, you only need one camera, so unless you add and need more than one instance of camera, it's best not to change this property. The camera ID is the return value of this function if no error occurs.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.iWear.iWearDllBridge
member.summary: A DLL bridge to access the VR920s/iWear stereo and head tracking driver.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.iWear.iWearDllBridge.IWRMagSensor
member.summary:
A struct that contains the magnetic sensor information from Wrap 920 tracker.
magx_msb,magx_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the magnetic sensor in the x-direction. magy_msb,magy_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the magnetic sensor in the y-direction. magz_msb,magz_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the magnetic sensor in the z-direction.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.iWear.iWearDllBridge.IWRAccelSensor
member.summary:
A struct that contains the accelerometer sensor information from Wrap 920 tracker.
accx_msb,accx_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the accelerometer sensor in the x-direction. accy_msb,accy_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the accelerometer sensor in the y-direction. accz_msb,accz_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the accelerometer sensor in the z-direction.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.iWear.iWearDllBridge.IWRGyroSensor
member.summary:
A struct that contains the gyro sensor information from Wrap 920 tracker. This struct contains high bandwidth gyros with 2000 degress per second.
gyx_msb,gyx_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the gyroscope sensor in the x-direction. gyy_msb,gyy_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the gyroscope sensor in the y-direction. gyz_msb,gyz_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the gyroscope sensor in the z-direction.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.iWear.iWearDllBridge.IWRLBGyroSensor
member.summary:
A struct that contains the gyro sensor information from Wrap 920 tracker. This struct contains low bandwidth gyros with 500 degress per second.
gyx_msb,gyx_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the gyroscope sensor in the x-direction. gyy_msb,gyy_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the gyroscope sensor in the y-direction. gyz_msb,gyz_lsb can be combined into a single 16-bit 2 compliment number with a range of -2048 2047 for the gyroscope sensor in the z-direction.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DRadioButton
member.summary:
An implementation of a radio button, which is a button that can be selected or deselected.
If you want to have at most one radio button selected at any time within a group of radio buttons, create a ButtonGroup instance, and add those radio buttons to the ButtonGroup instance. For multiple groups, you should use multiple ButtonGroup instances.
In order to display the text next to the radio button, G2DButton.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the text will not show up. Note that the size of the radio button icon depends on the font size. The larger the font size, the larger the radio button icon.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.Generic.MouseInput
member.summary: A helper class for handling the mouse input. This class wraps the functionalities provided by XNA's MouseState class, and mouse events are handled based on interrupt method (callback functions), rather than polling method (XNA's MouseState), so that the developer doesn't need to poll the status of the mouse state every frame by herself/himself.
member.remarks: MouseInput is a singleton class, so you should access this class through Instance property.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.DebugShapeRenderer
member.summary: A system for handling rendering of various debug shapes.
member.remarks:
The DebugShapeRenderer allows for rendering line-base shapes in a batched fashion. Games will call one of the many Add* methods to add a shape to the renderer and then a call to Draw will cause all shapes to be rendered. This mechanism was chosen because it allows game code to call the Add* methods wherever is most convenient, rather than having to add draw methods to all of the necessary objects.
Additionally the renderer supports a lifetime for all shapes added. This allows for things like visualization of raycast bullets. The game would call the AddLine overload with the lifetime parameter and pass in a positive value. The renderer will then draw that shape for the given amount of time without any more calls to AddLine being required.
The renderer's batching mechanism uses a cache system to avoid garbage and also draws as many lines in one call to DrawUserPrimitives as possible. If the renderer is trying to draw more lines than are allowed in the Reach profile, it will break them up into multiple draw calls to make sure the game continues to work for any game.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.Translation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the post-translation component that will be applied after rotation and scaling.
If WorldTransformation matrix is set directly after setting this property, then the value set for this property will not affect the transformation of this node.
member.remarks: If ReadOnly is set to true, then you can't set this property. Synonym of PostTranslation property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.PostTranslation
member.summary: Gets or sets the post-translation component that will be applied after rotation and scaling.
member.remarks: Synonym of Translation property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.PreTranslation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the pre-translation component that will be applied before rotation and scaling.
If WorldTransformation matrix is set directly after setting this property, then the value set for this property will not affect the transformation of this node.
member.remarks: If ReadOnly is set to true, then you can't set this property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.Rotation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the rotation component.
If WorldTransformation matrix is set directly after setting this property, then the value set for this property will not affect the transformation of this node.
member.remarks: If ReadOnly is set to true, then you can't set this property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.Scale
member.summary:
Gets or sets the scale component.
If WorldTransformation matrix is set directly after setting this property, then the value set for this property will not affect the transformation of this node.
member.remarks: If ReadOnly is set to true, then you can't set this property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.WorldTransformation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the transformation matrix. If you set this matrix directly, then whatever you set on Translation, Rotation, and Scale properties previoulsy will be ignored, and instead, this matrix value will be used to define the transformation of this node.
However, if you set any of the Translation, Rotation, and Scale properties after setting this matrix, then the composed matrix value from these three properties will be used.
member.remarks: If ReadOnly is set to true, then you can't set this property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.UseUserDefinedTransform
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user directly modified the transformation matrix instead using the composed one from Translation, Rotation, and Scale properties.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.UserDefinedTransformChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the transformation matrix set directly by the user has been modified from the last one.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.ComposedTransform
member.summary: Gets the matrix composed from each individual transformation properties (Translation, Rotation, and Scale).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.IsWorldTransformationDirty
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the transformation has been modified from the previous one.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this transform node is read only. If true, then you can not set any of the Translation, Rotation, Scale, and WorldTransformation properties.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider
member.summary:
A slider lets the user graphically select a value by sliding a knob within a bounded interval. The slider can show both major tick marks and minor tick marks between them, as well as labels.
In order to display the value labels, G2DSlider.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the labels will not show up.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.valueIsAdjusting
member.summary: Indicator of whether the current changes to the value property are part of a series of changes

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.#ctor(GoblinXNA.GoblinEnums.Orientation,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a slider with specified orientation, and minimum, maximum, and initial values.
member.param: The orientation of the slider
The minimum value the slider can take
The maximum value the slider can take
An initial value between the range of min and max values

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a horizontal slider with the specified minimum, maximum, and initial values.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a horizontal slider with the specified minimum and maximum values. The initial value is set to the average value of min and max.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.#ctor(GoblinXNA.GoblinEnums.Orientation)
member.summary: Creates a slider in the range between 0 and 10 with the specified orientation and initial value of 5.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.#ctor
member.summary: Craetes a horizontal slider in the range between 0 and 10 with initial value of 5.

member.summary: Paints dashed border when focused.

member.name: E:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.StateChangedEvent
member.summary: An event triggered whenever the slider value changes.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the slider's current value

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the slider's maximum value

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the slider's minimum value

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the slider's orientation

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.KnobLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the knob.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.Extent
member.summary: Gets the range of values "covered" by the knob

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.MajorTickSpacing
member.summary:
Gets or sets the slider's major tick spacing.
For example, for a max value of 10 and min value of 0, major tick spacing of 5 will draw major ticks at 0, 5, and 10.
member.exception: If MinorTickSpacing is set and this value is smaller than MinorTickSpacing

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.MinorTickSpacing
member.summary:
Gets or sets the slider's minor tick spacing.
For example, for a max value of 10 and min value of 0, minor tick spacing of 2 will draw minor ticks at 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10. NOTE: If there is an overlap between major ticks and minor ticks, only major ticks will be shown

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.SnapToTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to make the knob resolve to the closest tick mark next to where the user positioned the knob

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.PaintTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to paint the ticks including both major and minor ticks.
member.remarks: Major tick spacing has to be defined before the ticks can be painted

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.PaintLabels
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to paint the labels.
member.remarks: Labels are only shown below major ticks. Also, major tick spacing has to be defined before the labels can be painted

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.PaintTrack
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to paint the track behind the knob

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.ValueIsAdjusting
member.summary: Gets whether the current changes to the value property are part of a series of changes

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.DESSmoother
member.summary: A helper class for smoothing out the incoming matrix values based on double exponential smoothing (DES) algorithm (The equations can be found at http://www.itl.nist.gov/div898/handbook/pmc/section4/pmc433.htm). We use 'b1 = y2 - y1' equation to set the initial value of b1.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.ISmoother
member.summary: An interface for matrix smoothing/filtering classes.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.ISmoother.FilterMatrix(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Quaternion@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix@)
member.summary: Gets a filtered matrix based on the given position and orientation.
member.param: The original position
The original rotation
A smoothed/filterd matrix

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.ISmoother.ResetHistory
member.summary: Resets the smoothing history.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.ISmoother.Save(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Saves the information of this smoother to an XML element.
member.param: The XML document to be saved.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.ISmoother.Load(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Loads the information of this smoother from an XML element.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.DESSmoother.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a DES smoother with alpha and gamma values ([0.0f - 1.0f] excluding 0) without translation or rotational threhold. Both translation and rotation alpha and gamma values will be set to 'alpha' and 'gamma' respectively.
member.param: The alpha value used in the first equation (see the website mentioned in the summary of this class). The larger the alpha value, the heavier the weight of the incoming matrix. If alpha is 0.3f, then the smoothed matrix will be roughly incoming * 0.3f + previous * 0.7f.
The gamma value used in the second equation.
member.exception: If alpha or gamma values are outside of the range

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.DESSmoother.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a DES smoother with alpha and gamma values ([0.0f - 1.0f] excluding 0) separately for translational and rotational smoothing without translation or rotational threhold.
member.param: An alpha value for translational smoothing
A gamma value for translational smoothing
An alpha value for rotational smoothing
A gamma value for rotational smoothing
member.exception: If alpha or gamma values are outside of the range

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.DESSmoother.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a smoother with alpha and gamma values ([0.0f - 1.0f] excluding 0) separately for translational and rotational smoothing with translation or rotational threhold.
member.param: An alpha value for translational smoothing
A gamma value for translational smoothing
An alpha value for rotational smoothing
A gamma value for rotational smoothing

A translational threshold. If set to larger than 0, then if the distance between the previous transformation and the current transformation is larger than this threshold, then the current transformation will be dropped from the smoothing calculation.

A rotational threshold. If set to largen than 0, then if the angle (in radians) between the previous transformation and the current transformation is larger than this threshold, then the current transformation will be dropped from the smoothing calculation.
member.exception: If alpha or gamma values are outside of the range

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.DESSmoother.FilterMatrix(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Quaternion@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix@)
member.summary: Gets a filtered matrix using double exponential smoothing algorithm.
member.param: The original position
The original rotation
A smoothed matrix

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.DESSmoother.ComputeDESMatrix(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Quaternion@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix@)
member.summary: Performs the DES algorithm.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.Capture.PointGrey.PGRFlyModule.FlyCaptureTimestamp
member.summary:
This structure defines the format in which time is represented in the PGRFlycapture SDK. The ulSeconds and ulMicroSeconds values represent the absolute system time when the image was captured. The ulCycleSeconds and ulCycleCount are higher-precision values that have either been propagated up from the 1394 bus or extracted from the image itself. The data will be extracted from the image if image timestamping is enabled and directly (and less accurately) from the 1394 bus otherwise.
The ulCycleSeconds value will wrap around after 128 seconds. The ulCycleCount represents the 1/8000 second component. Use these two values when synchronizing grabs between two computers sharing a common 1394 bus that may not have precisely synchronized system timers. (adapted from PGRFlyCapture.h)

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Device.Capture.PointGrey.PGRFlyModule.FlyCaptureTimestamp.ulSeconds
member.summary: The number of seconds since the epoch.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Device.Capture.PointGrey.PGRFlyModule.FlyCaptureTimestamp.ulMicroSeconds
member.summary: The microseconds component.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Device.Capture.PointGrey.PGRFlyModule.FlyCaptureTimestamp.ulCycleSeconds
member.summary: The cycle time seconds. 0-127.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Device.Capture.PointGrey.PGRFlyModule.FlyCaptureTimestamp.ulCycleCount
member.summary: The cycle time count. 0-7999. (1/8000ths of a second.)

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Device.Capture.PointGrey.PGRFlyModule.FlyCaptureTimestamp.ulCycleOffset
member.summary: The cycle offset. 0-3071 (1/3072ths of a cycle count.)

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Shaders.SimpleEffectShader
member.summary: An implementation of a simple shader that uses the BasicEffect class.
member.remarks: Since BasicEffect class can only include upto three light sources, if more than three light sources are passed to this class, then the local light sources precede the global light sources. Both the global and local light nodes are added in the order of encounter in the preorder tree-traversal of the scene graph. For local lights, the last light node is the closest light node in the scene graph, so the light sources are added in the reverse order. If there are less than three local light sources, then global light sources are added in the normal order.

member.summary: A point source is defined as a single point in space. The intensity of the light is attenuated with three attenuation coefficients.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightType.Directional
member.summary: A directional source is described by the direction in which it is pointing, and is useful for modeling a light source that is effectively infinitely far away from the objects it illuminates.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightType.SpotLight
member.summary: A spotlight is useful for creating dramatic localized lighting effects. It is defined by its position, the direction in which it is pointing, and the width of the beam of light it produces.

member.summary: Gets the transformed version of the Direction property by the associated LightNode's WorldTransformation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the zero-th degree attenuation coefficient for estimating light energy attenuation. This property is used only for Point and SpotLight types. The default value is 0.01f.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Attenuation1
member.summary: Gets or sets the first degree attenuation coefficient for estimating light energy attenuation. This property is used only for Point and SpotLight types. The default value is 0.1f.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Attenuation2
member.summary: Gets or sets the second degree attenuation coefficient for estimating light energy attenuation. This property is used only for Point and SpotLight types. The default value is 0.0f.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.InnerConeAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the inner radius of the spotlight where the light begins to be attenuated. This property is used only for SpotLight type. The default value is 0.2f * PI (36 degrees).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.OuterConeAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the outer radius of the spotlight where the light intensity (ambient) is zero. The default value is 0.3f * PI (54 degrees).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Range
member.summary: Gets or sets the effective range of this light source. This property is used only for Point and SpotLight types. The default value is 500.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Vision.OpenCVWrapper.cvCanny(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Implements the Canny algorithm for edge detection.
member.remarks: The function finds the edges on the input image image and marks them in the output image edges using the Canny algorithm. The smallest value between threshold1 and threshold2 is used for edge linking, the largest value is used to find the initial segments of strong edges.
member.param: Single-channel input image
Single-channel image to store the edges found by the function
Aperture parameter for the Sobel operator

In order to display the text next to the check box, G2DButton.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the text will not show up. Note that the size of the radio button icon depends on the font size. The larger the font size, the larger the radio button icon.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Helpers.MatrixHelper.HasMovedSignificantly(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary: Checks whether a transformation has changed/moved significantly compared to the previous transformation with 0.01f translational threshold and 0.1f * Math.PI / 180 rotational threshold. This means that if either the transformation's translation component changed more than 0.1f in distance or rotation component changed more than 0.1f * Math.PI / 180 radians in any of the three (x, y, z) directions, then it's judged as having moved significantly.
member.param: The previous transformation matrix
The current transformation matrix

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Helpers.MatrixHelper.HasMovedSignificantly(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Checks whether a transformation has changed/moved significantly compared to the previous transformation with the specified translational threshold and rotational threshold.
member.param: The previous transformation matrix
The current transformation matrix
The translational threshold
The rotational threshold

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Helpers.MatrixHelper.PrepareUnproject(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary: Prepares for the Unproject function (which is 30 times faster than Viewport.Unproject)

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Helpers.MatrixHelper.Unproject(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@)
member.summary: Unproject method that is 30 times faster than the Viewport.Unproject function due to the usage of pre-computed values. Make sure to call PrepareUnproject method for the pre-computation to happen, and then call this Unproject method unless any of the variables passed in to PrepareUnproject changes (if they do change, make sure to call it again with update values to guarantee correct unprojection).
member.remarks: This code is from MSDN forum (http://forums.create.msdn.com/forums/p/57082/348602.aspx). Credit goes to nathanjervis.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Helpers.MatrixHelper.Project(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@)
member.summary: Project method
member.remarks: This code is based on the HLSL code provided on http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/xnaframework/thread/fa479f61-c31f-4b73-b7a4-29d101b79048/ . Credit goes to riemerg.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Helpers.Log
member.summary: Log will create automatically a log file and write log/warning/error info for simple runtime error checking, which is very useful for minor errors. The application can still continue working, but this log provides an easy way to find errors. Also, you can enable WriteToNotifier to make the log message appear on the screen if State.ShowNotification is enabled.

member.summary: Gets the intersection parameter with value ranging from 0.0f (near point) to 1.0f (far point).
member.remarks: For example, 0.5f means the intersection point was right in the middle of near point and far point cast ray. To get the picked point, you can simply do pickedPoint = (nearPoint + (farPoint - nearPoint) * intersectParam)

Helps to compare strings, uses case insensitive comparison.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.Fancy.G2DSuggestField
member.summary: A suggestion field is a text field that provides a list of possible text inputs such as search terms in a drop down box every time the user modifies a text in the field. If the user selects one of the texts in the suggestion list, the text in the text field will be replaced with the selected one. The suggestion list disappears either if a selection is made or the user presses 'Enter' key.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.Fancy.G2DSuggestField.MatchFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets a matching function used to identify which texts from the list of possible text inputs should be displayed based on the current text typed in the text field. This matching function is used only if Criteria property is set to MatchCriteria.Custom.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.Fancy.G2DSuggestField.KeepSuggestionBoxOpaque
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to keep the suggestion box to render in opaque background. If set to false, then the suggestion box will have the same transparency value as this component. If true, the suggestion box will remain opaque even if this component's transparency value is modified. The default value is true.
member.remarks: If there are other UI components positioned below this component, then it's better to set this property to true.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Model.OffsetTransform
member.summary: Gets the offset transformation from the origin of the world coordinate.
member.remarks: If not provided, this transform will be calculated based on the following equation: OffsetTranslation.Translation = (MinimumBoundingBox.Min + MinimumBoundingBox.Max) / 2. In this case, no rotation offset will be calculated.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Model.OffsetToOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to relocate the model to the origin. Each model has its position stored in the model file, but if you want to relocate the model to the origin instead of locating it based on the position stored in the file, you should set this to true. The default value is false.

member.summary: A shader that implements the DirectX 9's fixed-pipeline lighting, and there is no limitation on the number of light sources it can handle. This shader can render directional, point, and spot lights (the equations used for each light type can be found from http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb174697(VS.85).aspx).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Shaders.DirectXShader.UsePS20
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to force this shader to use Pixel Shader 2.0 profile even if the graphics card support Pixel Shader 3.0. By default, this is set to true.
member.remarks: When there are less than fifty lights, it's faster to use Pixel Shader 2.0 profile. However, if you have more than fifty lights, Pixel Shader 3.0 will perform better.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial
member.summary: A default implementation of the IPhysicsMaterial interface. A physics material defines how two materials behave when they physically interact, including support for friction and elasticity.
Creates a physics material that defines two materials behave when they physically interact.
member.remarks: 'materialName1' and 'materialName2' can be the same if you want to define how the same material behave when they physically interact.
member.param: The first material name
The second material name
Whether these two materials are collidable
The static friction coefficient
The kinetic friction coefficient
The softness of the material. Softness defines how fiercely the two materials will repel from each other when the two materials penetrate against each other
The elasticity coefficient
The callback function when two materials begin to contact. Set to 'null' if you don't need this callback function.
The callback function when two materials proceed contact. Set to 'null' if you don't need this callback function.
The callback function when two materials end contact. Set to 'null' if you don't need this callback function.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a physics material with empty material names and no callback functions.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.MaterialName1
member.summary: Gets or sets the first material name

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.MaterialName2
member.summary: Gets or sets the second material name

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.Collidable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether these two materials can collide.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.StaticFriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the static friction between the two materials.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.KineticFriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the kinetic/dynamic friction between the two materials.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.Softness
member.summary: Gets or sets the softness between the two materials. This property is used only when the two objects interpenetrate. The larger the value, the more restoring force is applied to the interpenetrating objects. Restoring force is a force applied to make both interpenetrating objects push away from each other so that they no longer interpenetrate.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.Elasticity
member.summary: Gets or sets the elasticity between the two materials.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.ContactBeginCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the delegate/callback function called when contact begins between two materials.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.ContactProcessCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the delegate/callback function called when contact proceeds between two materials.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.ContactEndCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the delegate/callback function called when contact ends between two materials.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.ContactBegin
member.summary: A delegate/callback function that defines what to do when two physics objects begin to contact.
member.param: One of the collided pair
The other of the collided pair

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.ContactProcess
member.summary: A delegate/callback function that defines what to do when the contact proceeds between the two physics objects.
member.param: The position of the contact between the two objects
The normal of the contact
The speed of the contact
One of the collided pair's (physObj1 returned from ContactBegin callback function) contact tangent speed.
The other of the collided pair's (physObj2 returned from ContactBegin callback function) contact tangent speed.
One of the collided pair's (physObj1 returned from ContactBegin callback function) contact tangent direction.
The other of the collided pair's (physObj1 returned from ContactBegin callback function) contact tangent direction.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.NewtonMaterial.ContactEnd
member.summary: A delegate/callback function that defines what to do when the contact process ends.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Geometry.Sphere.#ctor(System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a sphere of the given radius centered around the origin. The sphere is subdivided around the Y axis into slices and along the Y axis into stacks (similar to lines of longitude and latitude).
member.param: Specifies the radius of the sphere.
Specifies the number of subdivisions around the Y axis (similar to lines of longitude). This has to be greater than 4 and less than 101.
Specifies the number of subdivisions along the Y axis (similar to lines of latitude). This has to be greater than 4 and less than 101.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.ButtonGroup
member.summary:
This class is used to create a multiple-exclusion scope for a set of buttons. Creating a set of buttons with the same ButtonGroup object means that turning "on" one of those buttons turns "off" all other buttons in the group. Typically, a button group contains G2DRadioButton.
Initially, all buttons in the group are unselected. Once any button is selected, one button is always selected in the group.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerBundleNode
member.summary:
A scene graph node that defines a bundle of optically tracked fiducial marker arrays. The supporting marker nodes can supplement the tracking of the base marker array if the base marker array is not visible.
Any nodes added below a MarkerBundleNode with WorldTranformation properties will be affected by the transformation returned by the marker tracker including GeometryNode, ParticleNode, SoundNode, CameraNode, and LightNode.
member.remarks: Do not add any of the supporting marker nodes to the scene since they will be updated automatically by this node.

A marker tracker used to track this fiducial marker

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.JointInfo
member.summary: General joint information that applies to all of the joint types implemented in Newton dynamics library.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.JointInfo.EnableCollision
member.summary: Enable or disable collision between the two bodies linked by this joint. Defalut value is false.
member.remarks: Usually when two bodies are linked by a joint, the application wants collision between this two bodies to be disabled. This is the default behavior of joints when they are created, however when this behavior is not desired the application can change it by setting collision on. If the application decides to enable collision between jointed bodies, the application should make sure the collision geometry do not collide in the work space of the joint.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.JointInfo.Stiffness
member.summary: Gets or sets the strength coeficient to be applied to the joint reaction forces. Default value is 0.9f, and must be between 0.0 and 1.0.
member.remarks:
Constraint keep bodies together by calculating the exact force necessary to cancel the relative acceleration between one or more common points fixed in the two bodies. The problem is that when the bodies drift apart due to numerical integration inaccuracies, the reaction force work to pull eliminated the error but at the expense of adding extra energy to the system, does violating the rule that constraint forces must be work less. This is a inevitable situation and the only think we can do is to minimize the effect of the extra energy by dampening the force by some amount. In essence the stiffness coefficient tell Newton calculate the precise reaction force by only apply a fraction of it to the joint point. And value of 1.0 will apply the exact force, and a value of zero will apply only 10 percent.
The stiffness is set to a all around value that work well for most situation, however the application can play with these parameter to make finals adjustment. A high value will make the joint stronger but more prompt to vibration of instability; a low value will make the joint more stable but weaker.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.BallAndSocketJoint
member.summary: A joint info class that represents Newton's ball and socket joint interface.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.BallAndSocketJoint.#ctor(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates a ball and socket joint with the given 'pivot'.
member.param: The origin of ball and socket in global space.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.BallAndSocketJoint.Pin
member.summary: Sets a pointer to a unit vector defining the cone axis in global space. If this value is set to other than new Vector3(), the cone and twist limits of this ball and socket joint will be set. In that case, you need to set MaxConeAngle and MaxTwistAngle as well.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.BallAndSocketJoint.MaxConeAngle
member.summary: Sets the max angle in radians the attached body is allow to swing relative to the pin axis.
member.remarks: A value of zero disable the cone limit. All non-zero values are clamped between 5 degree and 175 degrees.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.BallAndSocketJoint.MaxTwistAngle
member.summary: Sets the kax angle in radians the attached body is allow to twist relative to the pin axis.
member.remarks: A value of zero disable the twist limit.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Newton1.BallAndSocketJoint.NewtonBallCallback
member.summary: Sets an update call back to be called when either of the two bodies linked by the joint is active.
member.remarks: If the application wants to have some feedback from the joint simulation, the application can register a function update callback to be called every time any of the bodies linked by this joint is active. This is useful to provide special effects like particles, sound or even to simulate breakable moving parts.
